headline: GM Reshapes North American Footprint With Oshawa Cuts And U.S. Focus
summary: GM (NYSE:GM) is cutting more than 700 jobs at its Oshawa, Canada plant as part of a reset of its North American production footprint. The automaker is directing new investment into U.S. factories and workforce development programs, with a focus on domestic manufacturing. The moves come as trade tensions and policy shifts continue to influence where automakers place production and jobs across borders. GM, through its NYSE:GM listing, gives investors exposure to a large U.S. based automaker...
